name: Grand Palladium Riviera Resort & Spa

reviews.text: My husband and I traveled with our 3 young children (ages 8, 6 and 4). We also traveled at the same time as 3 other families/neighbors and all stayed in the same building near the beach at the Riviera. The Riviera/White Sands is on one end of the resort and share a pool. The Colonial/Kantenah are on the other end and share a pool. Supposedly, the Riviera/White Sands was newer, but we could not see any difference to the lobby/pool facilities in comparison to the Colonial/Kantenah. The room was nice, but there was practically NO drawer space or dresser for a family of 5. We had the closet which had 3 small shelves in it and 3 tiny drawers in the desk (THAT WAS IT!!) We had to take the phone book out of the nightstand to use as a drawer and then place our clothes in stacks on a small table. Our screen was broken and barely opened and closed. The bathrooms were nice but many times the maid would not fully restock our clean towels and we would have to call and wait for more.
reviews.title: Fell a bit short of our expectations

likes.liked: — Pretty lobbies, nice beach, beautiful water
likes.disliked: — Wasn't very clean, not super family friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Colonial/Kantenah was much more family friendly with more kids' activities and the more kid-friendly portion of the beach. The beach closer to the Riviera/White Sands was more full of seaweed and rocks. The pool and lobby at the Riviera/White Sands was more quiet and not much happening. So we ended up spending days 2-6 at the Colonial/ Kantenah.
reviews.title: Very good, but not truly exceptional

reviews.text: The buffet food was average as was expected. A la carte restaurant service was offered every night which was a bonus (although we thought we were only getting 2 nights of a la carte and did not bring enough acceptable attire), but service was slow and it would take 2 hours per dinner. The food at these restaurants was good at best (much better than buffet). THe 4 a la carte restaurants at Colonial/Kantenah were much better than the 4 at Riviera/White Sands.
reviews.title: “Excellent resort, would go back”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities many times were unkempt. The pool and beach bathrooms were dirty on many occasions (i.e. toilet paper on the floor, no toilet paper in stalls, full garbage cans, messy counters). The garbage cans at the pool were many times stacked full from the prior day/night and were not cleaned until the afternoon. The tables at the lunch buffet were often dirty (80-90% of the tables) and we would end up bussing them ourselves to find a place to sit. The nacho bin and ice cream machine at the bar were many times empty. We saw debris near the pool chairs (limes, dirty plastic cups, trash) from the prior day and would need to clean up our area ourselves.
reviews.title: Loved the large jacuzzi tub!!!

likes.disliked: — The bus ride to the resort..is approx 60 mins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was slow at the bars most times and the resort does not have any staff members walking around at the pool serving drinks or taking drink orders. You must go to one of the bars to get your own drink and throw your own empties away.
reviews.title: Great Escape Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Royal Suites at the Grand Palladium Resort in the Mayan Riviera is an adult only section of the large resort complex Grand Palladium. There are four separate check-ins for the : Grand Palladium White Sand Resort & Spa, the Grand Palladium Colonial Resort & Spa, the Grand Palladium Kantenah Resort & Spa and the VIP area “The Royal Suites”.
reviews.title: You Feel Like Special Guests!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I believe there are four low level buildings (three floors each) housing the guests of the Royal Suites. Each building has a dedicated butler who assists with any needs throughout your stay. The quality of the service is nothing less than outstanding. You have access to the entire resort complex and can go to any of the 16 restaurants (including ability to make reservations the day before). I believe that the other sections of the resort do not allow you to make dinner reservations so consider this as a tremendous benefit. The quality of the food and drink was outstanding - a big surprise to us as we have never done all inclusive resorts before as we have heard food is not very high standard. In our experience every restaurant had excellent quality and variety. Our dining experience included seafood on the beach, sushi in the Japanese restaurant and Brazilian. In addition the Royal Suites has its own restaurant open for breakfast and supper with excellent choices from buffet and a la carte. We only had 6 nights and didn't go outside the resort for any meals - why would anyone?
reviews.title: Disappointed room service

reviews.text: Each of the resort complexes have beautiful pools including one very large family-oriented pool which is the hub for anyone wanting to participate in a range of activities scheduled by the resort. Again the guests of the Royal Suites can go anywhere but why would you when you have your own beautiful, private, quiet pool just a step away from your room.
reviews.title: A great experience

likes.disliked: — Rubbish Thompsons tour operators, nothing to do with the hotel though!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very nicely decorated with views primarily of the resort (which is beautiful) and in some cases you can see a bit of the ocean (there are a few units that have views out to the ocean but the Royal Suites are not beachside).
reviews.title: a wonderful time

likes.liked: — very clean and well maintained, attractive and spacious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent place to stay if you want to walk as there are a variety of places to get in several km of walking on the beautiful beach and throughout the resortsgardens. The various parts of the hotels (lobbies,paths) are excellent places to walk in the evening when the light fades. The builders of the resort have managed to build beautiful, modern facilities to fit with the environment. There are iguanas basking in the sun as you walk on the pathways through the mangroves.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous! Take the Royal Suite option!

likes.disliked: — beds were a little hard, bathrooms had little privacy in the room, but still very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took me awhile to reasearch hotels in Mexico. I found soo many of them having many complaints such as theft, food poisioning, lack of service etc. At one point I was ready to throw in the towel and not go to Mexico assuming it was just a bad place to vacation. I am glad that I didnt. The Grand Palladium is an excellent resort. Im gonna try to be quick about this....but I like to talk.
reviews.title: More than I expected

reviews.text: Rooms- We stayed in the basic Jr. suite and it is all you need. The rooms are large, they have a balcony, couch, various desks and chairs, tv, mini bar (that is always filled), a/c is great, the bathroom has a shower and jacuzi tub (for some romance bring candles and bubble bath). The safe in the room is good, you set it with your own code. The only thing that was annoying was the lighting seemed a bit dim. The walls are somewhat thin....I could hear the peson in the next room snoring in the middle of the night. A couple times we did have people playing loud music and/or yelling somewhere in the building. However not to worry! If you are sensitive to noise (like me) just turn on the room fan and it all gets drowned out.
reviews.title: Amazing trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food-The buffets were fine. I found the best time to eat there was at lunch. We ate there once for dinner our first night and wasnt too impressed. The breakfast was good...just a bit repetative but I think its up to you to change it up. My favorite buffet was the small one by the main pool. The al la carte resuraunts are good. We only made it to 6 out of the 8. Our favorite was Bamboo (asian) and the Ribs and More (ribs/meat). We missed out on the Japanese and Mexican but I am sure they were good. Something that I was worried about was that there was a limit as to how many times you can eat at the al la cartes. I assue you that even if you are a regular guest , you can go to all of them. The only difference is that the people staying in the Royal Suites are able to make reservations. Where as the others its first come first serve. I advise you to go before 630, if you go any later you will have to wait an hour.
reviews.title: Loved the Riviera, Excellent Value

reviews.text: Overall service- Was fantastic. The waiters at the restaraunts work quickly and take care of you. The buffet is cafeteria style...but the cooks are going as fast as they can and you do have waiters walking around asking if u need coffee or anything. The seating procedure is slightly annoying....you cant just go find a seat. But its nothing too major. The bartenders work quick but if it gets busy the sevice can be slow. Maids, bellboys all did their jobs well. Some of the reviews said that there was a language thing going on here, but it wasnt the case. OK so the maids problably arent the best to ask a lot of questions, they speak the least amount, but I mean they are the maids. Everyone else spoke good english. We did have an issue at front desk. The car to pick us up to go to the airport was late and we were getting worried. I went to the front desk and they told me to go around the corner and look at the airline book. I told them I did and they just kinda stared at me and said to go get the number. So I go back to my bf and complain and he goes (I guess he spoke louder to them) but they picked up the phone and dialed a number. My bf talked to someone and they said that most times the pick up is always delayed. Sure enough 5 mins later they came. It wasnt about the english, they were just lazy.
reviews.title: Fun had by all

likes.disliked: — there were ants in our room, which they immediately sprayed and killed.

reviews.text: Tours- We went on 3 tours. The ruins, Tulum, and horse backriding. They all were good. Except for the "mistakes" in telling us the exact length of them. The ruins are very cool. But the entire tour took us 11 hours! We were told we'd get back at 6 but we didnt get back till 730. So much driving and a lot of blabbing by the guide. I would not reccomend this tour if you have kids. And even if you are adults...be prepared. We went to tulum for a half day. This was very nice and we were brought back on time. Horsebackriding was ok. This also had a time issue. Being told it was 4 hours and it was more like 6. The trails were boring...mostly straight, flat dirt, and 10 foot bushes. I got really burnt that day cause I was thinking "jungle". Riding the horse into the water was fantastic. But it was supposed to have an extra cost (we got it for free somehow). Overall the tours were ok. But if you can take transit I would reccomend it, to save time and money.
reviews.title: Well what can i say.............

likes.disliked: — safety issues with ponds, bridges and boat docks

reviews.title: Not So Great
reviews.text: Very disappointing .Not all it was cracked up to be. Does not reflect a 5 star rating. Very big resort lot of walking and stair climbing, 18 steps up 18 steps down. Not recommended for those with mobility problems or small children who cannot walk far. Service was very poor in all areas . Grounds not well groomed or kept up in many areas, transport between lobbies and villas few and far between. Buffets there are only two (for all 4 hotels), food very repetitive, have to stand in line and be escorted to a table. Even though tere were many vacant tables you had to wait to be seated. Trying to get a cup of coffee or water with your meal was frustrating by the time you got it your meal was over. Suite was large and nice, some days the coffee pot nor the coffee cups were cleaned ect ect. Animation team not very good at all, no activities on rainy or cloudy days when there were activities it was very low key and not much participation you hardly knew they were there.Pools were great especially the adult pools nice and quiet and no kids. Beach was okay ,quite rocky in many areas water shoes recommended. Only three bars by the beach, washrooms few and far between. A la Cartes, there are 8 in all. Good food and good service, do not know why the rest of the resort had such a problem with service. Water bottles can only be obtained by going to reception not given out by bars ect (unless you only wanted a glass of water or from your bar fridge in your room). Would not recommend nor would I go back.

reviews.title: Resort is gorgeous
reviews.text: Manitoba

reviews.title: awesome awesome awesome
reviews.text: Group of 9 family members just got back from a week at the Grand Palladium Riviera. Let me start with the good--the resort itself is absolutely gorgeous!! Lots of trees and flowers--beautifully maintained. The rooms are large and very nice. Great big shower, jet tub, lots of space. Beautiful marble everywhere!! We stayed in the junior suites--just a short jaunt to the beach. The pools were very nice--clean and well maintained. Now the not so good....service isn't the greatest. It took 2 days for security to come to reset 2 of our safes--that was after many phone calls. Bars didn't have enough help--usually only 1 bartender per bar. If you want to be able to make reservations at the restaurants, you need to stay at the Royale--those staying there get preferential treatment. We waited just about 2 hours to eat when others from the Royale walked right in. Not a good thing at all!! The beach was nice--beautiful white sand, but kinda' dirty. No one out there at all to clean up the junk washed up on shore. The resort itself is HUGE!!! Be prepared to do lots of walking to get to where you want to go. Staff wasn't overly friendly--and most do not speak good English. Hard to get our point across at times--very frustrating!! The worst thing was the topless sunbathing--a big no no--at least I think--at a family resort. In fact, one gal totally stripped down at the pool to put on her swimming suit. Holy Cows!!! Would I go back to this resort?? Probably not.

reviews.title: Amazing experience returned for the 3rd year in a row!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: we booked threw signature so we were the first drop off it took about an hour and a half.we stayed in the royal suites all the extras are well worth it!!! if your staying in this section tell the bell boys right away they will come and pick you up and take you to your lobby.theres food and drinks and the computers are there its very refreshing after along travel day:)

reviews.title: ALL TRUE !!!!
reviews.text: we stayed in the jr.suite they are huge! and so nice it has a big shower and his and hers sinks, make up mirror and the hair dryer works well so no need to bring your own!! lots of space.

aka: Grand Palladium Riviera Resort And Spa
description: The Grand Palladium Riviera Resort & Spa is located sea front with superb access to the beach and is only 20 minutes from Playa del Carmen. Guests are invited to use the facilities provided by the adjoining Grand Palladium Colonial Resort & Spa, the Grand Palladium Kantenah Resort & Spa, and the Grand Palladium White Sand Resort & Spa.
